Articles.Content:
I thought it was just people being silly here....

I know "Kerbol" is just a fan name, its called the Sun in-game.

I know the recruitment building is called the "Astronaut Complex", and not the "Kerbonaut Complex".

All that K stuff is just the kommunity having a good time, right? There are no in-game K-syndrome examples afterall....

Well..... http://i.imgur.com/WxUc7b8.jpg

NOOOOOO.....

Are there more examples that I have missed all this time?

That K stuff is not consistent, that's for sure.

I think Squad just does something like this when they're in the mood, just like the Kommunity

SunStationaryName = keliostationary

HomeStationaryName = keostationary

OtherStationaryName = stationary

SunSynchronousName = keliosynchronous

HomeSynchronousName = keosynchronous

OtherSynchronousName = synchronous

MolniyaName = Kolniya

from Contracts.cfg

Squid went too far but I find the K-Syndrome childish and I do not mind it having K's everywhere.

Edited July 15, 2015 by Feradose
huehue
Well, the loading screen says 'Adding K to every word'. BTW Mortal Kombat did it first.
And if you are a Linux/KDE user, you get two K-Syndromes at once.

SunStationaryName = keliostationary

HomeStationaryName = keostationary

OtherStationaryName = stationary

SunSynchronousName = keliosynchronous

HomeSynchronousName = keosynchronous

OtherSynchronousName = synchronous

MolniyaName = Kolniya

from Contracts.cfg

Contracts is not Squad but Arsonide. He's employed there now, but he started as a community modder.
"Adding K to every word" loading screen. Squad is not kidding around.

Squid went too far but I find the K-Syndrome childish and I do not mind it having K's everywhere.

XD 'Squid'

Also I don't get why the 'K' think annoys people. I think it is funny. How about ' Kerbal Komplex'

Contracts is not Squad but Arsonide. He's employed there now, but he started as a community modder.

It's in the stock game, it's Squad alright.

/me pops popcorn in anticipation of NovaSilisko reading this thread.
I kon't underskand, whats the kroblem? I'kve knever knotiked anykhink kekkre, mksk ke kk kour kimakikakion...

Well..... http://i.imgur.com/WxUc7b8.jpg

NOOOOOO.....

You just now noticed that?

Every time I see that it makes my blood boil; so terrible. I edit it to be proper and then block satellite contracts.

You just now noticed that?

Every time I see that it makes my blood boil; so terrible. I edit it to be proper and then block satellite contracts.

Just wondering why do you edit it if you just block the contracts any way?

Just wondering why do you edit it if you just block the contracts any way?

Clearly he hates it that much.

Just wondering why do you edit it if you just block the contracts any way?

I almost did the same yesterday, when he pointed me out in the direction of that config file.

It's the equivalent of twisting your heel after stepping on a spider. Make sure the damned thing is dead and stays dead.

Squid

Wat......

Wat......
I wonder why this is even turned on by default. Squid pls

That's not even the first time I've read that today

Just wondering why do you edit it if you just block the contracts any way?
To make the world right. I block satellite contracts because, while they may be a very lucrative and easy to chain contract, they bore the living daylights out of me.
"Adding 'K' to every word..."

Sat launches are the least offensive of the contracts to me from an immersion standpoint---that said, I almost always ignore them because as you say, they are incredibly boring

Of course those that I have done I destroy after completing the mission, since I don't actually own them and it would be wrong to use them at all, IMO.

The use of "kerbonaut" by people is sort of a peeve of mine since the astronaut complex is the astronaut complex, and Kerbin to "KERBonaut" would be like calling astronauts "EARTHonauts." Just dumb.

KkK kK kKkk KKK Kk k kk kkk k Kk KKK kkK KKk kkkk kKK kk K kkkk KkKk kK kKKk kk K kK kKkk kk KKkk kK K kk KKK Kk kK Kk Kkk kK kKKk kKKk kKk KKK kKKk kKk kk kK K k KkKk KKK Kkk kk Kk KKk kKkKkK

But I suppose Morse code composed of "k" and "K" instead of "." and "-" might be taking it a bit too far.
I've never understood the comedy in misspelling words. Not even a little bit.

I've never understood the comedy in misspelling words. Not even a little bit.

Your user name begins with a 'k' Koincidence?

Your user name begins with a 'k' Koincidence?

My first name is Cevin. I spell it Kevin to be humorous.
My name starts with a K, but it's silent.
